thread.title: Bachelor's Lace Morris Opens Up About Grant Kemp Split: I'm 'Shocked' He Moved on So Quickly
thread.title_full: Bachelor's Lace Morris Opens Up About Grant Kemp Split: I'm 'Shocked' He Moved on So Quickly

title: Bachelor's Lace Morris Opens Up About Grant Kemp Split: I'm 'Shocked' He Moved on So Quickly
text:
Emily Marcus 
The flames have gone out. Bachelor in Paradise season 3 sweethearts Lace Morris and Grant Kemp announced in November that they had called off their engagement , and Morris tells Us Weekly exclusively that the split took its toll but that she's now able to move forward. PHOTOS: Celebrity Splits of 2016 
“Life is getting a lot better," she told Us recently at the Bachelor Charity Premiere Party benefiting SheLift at Sycamore Tavern in Los Angeles. "I’m just looking forward to this year being so much better, and it took me a while to deal with the breakup. I did my own thing for a while. It hurt. So I’m just doing so much better, and it feels really good." PHOTOS: The Most Ridiculous ‘Bachelor’ and ‘Bachelorette’ Job Titles Ever 
When asked what happened that caused her whirlwind romance with the firefighter to lose steam, Morris replies, "I don’t know. Grant and I just both realized some differences, and we had enough respect to end it when we did instead of pulling it along longer than we needed to. But it just wasn’t working. It just wasn't working." Lace Morris and Grant Kemp Adam Larkey/Freeform via Getty Images 
She points out that the two of them no longer speak to each other, but that she's recently joined dating app Bumble and has also started meeting new guys on social media and in person. You May Also Like
